result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman E Leclercq was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $343 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roman E Leclercq

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

03:55 PM Defendant Roman E Leclercq in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve  5 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence 9/9/22 at 7 am

-Days credit for time served:  1 day
-Days credit to jail: 1 day

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DA surcharge
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other  CC  and DA surcharge due in 60 days



-DNA on file



-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Holly O or any child of Holly O. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:46 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
